columns.text: The goal of the task is to determine the minimum value of the benefits generated by the synergy of the two firms.

First, ***what is synergy between firms?***

When a firm is considering acquiring another firm, it does so based on knowing the ***value and return to be obtained by the combination of the two companies***. In this context, the term synergy is used to define the expected financial benefit.

Now, the synergy is expected to be a positive amount because otherwise, it would not make sense to value the acquisition of the company. 

So the synergy is the (positive) incremental net gain from the acquisition of a firm, and is determined as the difference between the value of the two companies combined minus the value of each company separately:
$$
\begin{equation}
\Delta V=V_{A B}-\left(V_{A}+V_{B}\right)
\end{equation}
$$

Where:

$V_A$ is the value of the firm $A$, 

$V_B$ is the value of the firm $B$, 

$V_{AB}$ is the value of the combined firms $A$ and $B$, and;

$\Delta V$ is the incremental net gain (the synergy between firms $A$ and $B$.

Therefore, from equation $(1)$ and equation $(2)$ we have:

$$
\begin{align*}
\Delta V=V_{A B}-\left(V_{A}+V_{B}\right)&>(V_{A}+V_{B_{\text{Market}}})-\left(V_{A}+V_{B}\right)\\[10pt]
\Delta V&>V_{B_{\text{Market}}}-V_{B}\\[10pt]
\Delta V&>\$228,000,000-\$214,000,000\\[10pt]
\Delta V&>\$14,000,000
\end{align*}
$$

Notice that, the value of both firms combined must be greater than the difference between the value offered by the Jam corporation for Pearl Inc. and its market value (Pearl Inc.).
This leads us to the conclusion that ***the synergistic benefits of the merger must be greater than $\bold{14}$ million***.
